# startEmulation()

**Instance Method**

Start the card emulation and present a modal user interface to the person using the app.

## Declaration

```swift
func startEmulation() async throws
```

## Discussion

Set the [doc://com.apple.corenfc/documentation/CoreNFC/CardSession/alertMessage] prior to calling this method.

This method throws an error of type [doc://com.apple.corenfc/documentation/CoreNFC/CardSession/Error] if card emulation fails. Possible error conditions are:

- [doc://com.apple.corenfc/documentation/CoreNFC/CardSession/Error/systemNotAvailable]
- [doc://com.apple.corenfc/documentation/CoreNFC/CardSession/Error/accessNotAccepted]
- [doc://com.apple.corenfc/documentation/CoreNFC/CardSession/Error/systemEligibilityFailed]
- [doc://com.apple.corenfc/documentation/CoreNFC/CardSession/Error/radioDisabled]

## Managing card emulation

- **CardSession.Error**: An error type that indicates problems with a card session.
- **stopEmulation(status:)**: Stop card emulation and display a status.
- **CardSession.EmulationUIStatus**: The final status to show in the user interface when ending card emulation.
- **isEmulationInProgress**: A Boolean value that indicates whether emulation is currently active.
